step.context: \text{Which of the below function has the derivative}\\ \text{as }e^{nx}\text{, where }n \in \mathbb{R}

step.tex: \begin{align} \text{Since , }\dfrac{d \left(e^{2x}\right)}{dx} &= 2 e^{2x}\\ \implies e^{2x} &= \dfrac{1}{2}.\dfrac{d}{dx}\left(e^{2x}\right) \end{align}\\ \therefore \text{anti derivative or integral of }e^{2x} \text{ is} \dfrac{e^{2x}}{2}\\
